result.execSummary:
The defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court orders restitution set at $0.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders amounts to be paid during period of probation. If revoked, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

*No weapons;

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with huber release for: work and child care (report date: 4/7/2017);

Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Grant Huebner and Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders repeater penalty enhancer and case 15CF4975 DISMISSED.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instruction received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the $7500.00 previously posted as bail in this matter on behalf of Mr. Hamilton be released forthwith by the Milwaukee County Clerk of Courts office to Reddin & Singer LLP. The balance of $5000.00 shall remain.
Atty Reddin has filed a motion  for $7500.00 cash bail previously forfeited by the court to be reinstated and forwarded to the law firm of Reddin & Singer, LLP for attorney fees and expenses .

Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidebar between counsels and court. Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney  Wineke informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 4-20-2016.  Jury trial date of 4-13-2016 is vacated.
The court will address bail motion on the next date when new counsel is appointed.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:15 am.

15RM013292  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/04/2015

Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Ron Dague for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF3977 that are attached to the complaint.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Richard Ticcioni-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/10/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Court ordered defendant  to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Amonte Damon Hamilton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
